official_title: A bill to amend section 334 of the Social Security Amendments of 1977 to make it clear that the exemption from the public pension offset provisions of title II of the Social Security Act is available to individuals (otherwise qualified for such exemption) who retired or could have retired from public service in the last month of the applicable period prescribed for such exemption, even in cases where the actual payment of the government annuity of pension involved could not begin until the following month.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to apply the exemption from the Government pension offset to individuals who satisfied or could have satisfied the requirements for entitlement to a monthly periodic benefit before the close of June 1983 and so became eligible for such benefit for June 1983 or the following month.
